I'm using determinant definition by expansion by the first row and trying to prove that swapping two columns changes determinant's sign to opposite.

I took the informal proof from here, 3th page, 4th theorem.
But I'm having problem defining necessary lists of column swaps, for start. See sorry at the end of proof attempt.

Cheers! :)

import Mathlib

def determinant: ∀ {n}, Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ → ℝ
| 0, _ => 1
| _ + 1, M => ∑ i, ((-1) ^ i.1 * M 0 i * determinant (M.submatrix Fin.succ i.succAbove))


theorem det_of_order_2 (M: Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ): determinant M = M 0 0 * M 1 1 - M 0 1 * M 1 0 := by
  unfold determinant
  simp
  unfold determinant
  simp
  unfold determinant
  simp
  ring


structure Swap (n: Nat) where
  mk :: (i1 i2: Fin n) (Hswap: i1 < i2)

def swap_cols {n} (M: Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) (s: Swap n): Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ :=
  Matrix.of (λ i j => if j = s.i1 then M i s.i2 else if j = s.i2 then M i s.i1 else M i j)

def swap_many_cols {n}: ∀ (M: Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ) (L: List (Swap n)), Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ
| M, [] => M
| M, x :: t => swap_many_cols (swap_cols M x) t

theorem determinant_if_swap_many_cols {n} (M: Matrix (Fin (n + 2)) (Fin (n + 2)) ℝ) (L: List (Swap (n + 2))):
  determinant (swap_many_cols M L) = (-1) ^ L.length * determinant M := by
  revert M
  induction n with
  | zero => induction L with
            | nil => simp
                     intros M
                     rw [swap_many_cols]
            | cons head tail ih => simp
                                   intros M
                                   rw [swap_many_cols]
                                   rw [ih]
                                   have H: (-1) ^ (tail.length + 1) * determinant M =
                                           (-1) ^ tail.length * (- determinant M) := by ring
                                   rw [H]
                                   congr
                                   cases head with | mk i1 i2 Hswap =>
                                   fin_cases i1 <;> fin_cases i2
                                   . exfalso
                                     simp at *
                                   . rw [swap_cols]
                                     rw [det_of_order_2, det_of_order_2]
                                     simp
                                   . rw [swap_cols]
                                     rw [det_of_order_2, det_of_order_2]
                                     simp
                                   . exfalso
                                     simp at *
  | succ n ih => induction L with
                 | nil => simp
                          intros m
                          rw [swap_many_cols]
                 | cons head tail ihL => simp
                                         intros M
                                         rw [swap_many_cols]
                                         rw [ihL]
                                         have H1: (-1) ^ (tail.length + 1) * determinant M =
                                                  (-1) ^ tail.length * (- determinant M) := by ring
                                         rw [H1]
                                         congr
                                         rw [determinant]
                                         rw [swap_cols]
                                         simp
                                         rw [Finset.sum_ite, Finset.sum_ite]
                                         rw [Finset.filter_eq']
                                         simp
                                         rw [Finset.filter_filter, Finset.filter_filter]
                                         have H2: ∀ a, (¬ a = head.i1 ∧ a = head.i2) ↔ a = head.i2 := by
                                           intros a
                                           cases head with | mk i1 i2 prop =>
                                           simp
                                           intro H2
                                           subst a
                                           omega
                                         rw [@Finset.filter_congr _ _ (λ a => a = head.i2) _ _ _ (by
                                           cases head
                                           simp
                                           omega
                                         )]
                                         rw [Finset.filter_eq']
                                         simp
                                         rw [<- swap_cols]
                                         sorry

Ok, now I believe that this approach is too bad/complex to formalise.
Will look at other informal proofs with hopes to find something better.

As a style comment to keep you from driving yourself crazy, I strongly recommend writing

induction L with
| nil =>
  simp -- only indented two spaces, not lots of spaces
| cons head tail ihL =>
  sorry -- also only two spaces

theorem determinant_expanded_by_first_two_rows {n} (M: Matrix (Fin (n + 2)) (Fin (n + 2)) ℝ):

I have sum with filter condition and the ite (if then else construction) under the sum sign which is equivalent to the ite condition (see the tiny lemma aux0). What's the best way to clear that ite away?

import Mathlib

def determinant: ∀ {n}, Matrix (Fin n) (Fin n) ℝ → ℝ
| 0, _ => 1
| _ + 1, M => ∑ i, ((-1) ^ i.1 * M 0 i * determinant (M.submatrix Fin.succ i.succAbove))

lemma aux: ∀ (n i: ℕ) (f: Fin n → ℝ),
  ∑ (j: Fin n), f j =
  ∑ (j ∈ Finset.filter (λ (x: Fin n) => x.1 < i) Finset.univ), f j +
  ∑ (j ∈ Finset.filter (λ (x: Fin n) => ¬ (x.1 < i)) Finset.univ), f j := by
  intros n i f
  apply Eq.symm
  rw [Finset.sum_filter_add_sum_filter_not]

lemma aux0 (n: ℕ) (x: Fin (n + 2)) (y: Fin (n + 1)): y.castSucc < x ↔ y.1 < x.1 := by
  cases x with | mk x Hx =>
  cases y with | mk y Hy =>
  simp

theorem determinant_expanded_by_first_two_rows {n} (M: Matrix (Fin (n + 2)) (Fin (n + 2)) ℝ):
  determinant M = ∑ (i: Fin (n + 2)), ∑ j ∈ Finset.filter (fun (j: Fin (n + 1)) ↦ ↑i < ↑j) Finset.univ,
    (-1) ^ (i.1 + j.1) * (M 1 i * M 0 j - M 1 j * M 0 i) * determinant (M.submatrix (Fin.succ ∘ Fin.succ) (i.succAbove ∘ j.succAbove)) := by
  rw [determinant]
  conv =>
    lhs
    congr
    . skip
    . intro i
      rw [determinant]
      rw [Finset.mul_sum]
      rw [aux _ i.1]
  simp
  unfold Fin.succAbove
  sorry

import Mathlib

lemma aux1 (n: ℕ) (p: Fin n → Prop) [DecidablePred p] (f g: Fin n → ℝ):
  ∑ i ∈ Finset.filter p Finset.univ, (if p i then f i else g i) =
  ∑ i ∈ Finset.filter p Finset.univ, f i := by
  rw [Finset.sum_ite_of_true]
  intros x Hx
  simp at *
  assumption
